section.title: The Swap Rate
section.p: This activity is the heart of this chapter - we will calculate the swap rate R. Recall that this is the fixed rate at which the payer makes payments, while the receiver uses floating rates.

At time 0, we will use the yield curve to find present values, and we use the implied forward rates as estimates of the floating rates that the receiver will pay. We will denote \iota_0(t-1,t) with the simpler \iota_0(t). But recall that individual problems may have their own notation -- use context.

introduction.p: A payer and receiver enter into a 4-year interest rate swap with annual payments and notional amount X. We will use the yield curve to find the swap rate R.

task.p: What is the amount of the annual fixed payment (in terms of R and X)?
What is the present value of the fixed payments (in terms of R and X)?
The floating payments will be based on the forward rates. Find the forward rates, then find the amount of each of the four floating payments (in terms of X).
Find the present value of the floating payments (in terms of X).
Why must the present values of the two legs be equal? (You do not have to be very specific here.)
Set your present values equal and solve for R.
What happened to the notional amount? What does that tell you?
